Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, two separated from the other by a black-painted division line.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393254) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393254)
